# LayerRenderer.Layout.shared

**Case**

A layout that uses a single texture to store the content for all rendered views.

## Declaration

```swift
case shared
```

## Discussion

When a layer contains multiple views, the texture stores the images for those views side-by-side. The texture map for each view contains a viewport that defines the boundaries of that view’s content. The type of each texture is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLTextureType/type2D].

## Getting the texture layouts

- **LayerRenderer.Layout.dedicated**: A layout that assigns a separate texture to each rendered view.
- **LayerRenderer.Layout.layered**: A layout that specifies each view’s content as a slice of a single texture.
